constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 102 (Wednesday, June 15, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. VAN DREW:
H.R. 8093.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The Congress shall have power to lay and collect taxes,
duties, imposts and excises, to pay the debts and provide for
the common defense and general welfare of the United States;
but all duties, imposts and excises shall be uniform
throughout the United States;
[Page H5611]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

title: Increasing Human Trafficking Awareness Act
